page.title: 16ORTON - JUBILEE YEAR
page.content: In 1977, Jubilee year, there were great celebrations in Orton. There was a sponsored walk around the Parish boundary_just over 30 miles; streets and houses were decorated with flags and bunting; a community tea was held _in the Market Hall for adults and in the Waverley Room for children. In the evening there was a "Tramp's Ball" and village entertainment. Every child received a commemorative beaker and badge. Mr Jackson Allan acted as Town Crier and travelled around the area announcing the various events _ slow bicycle race, comic football match, childrens sports and tug-of-war across the village stream. Exhibitions of local crafts and past Royal events were held in the Church and the School. Many artifacts of local interest were on display and the children made a model Jubilee Street.
